content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), ' ', '_')) |> replace(_, '-' => '_')
end
```

This function first converts `col` to lower case using the `lowercase` function, removes any leading or trailing white spaces using the `strip` function, and replaces all spaces with underscores using `replace`. It also replaces all hyphens with underscores.

In this way, you can clean your column name in Julia as per your requirements.
